message.content:
cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.GT. 

The paper discusses the optimization of online advertising, which involves machine learning and decision-making algorithms. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category. The paper also deals with content-based matching between webpages and ads, which falls under the Information Retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category. The use of Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes (POMDPs) and collaborative filtering suggests that the paper may also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the optimization of ad incomes, which involves game theory and optimization, making it likely to belong to the Game Theory (cs.GT) sub-category.
